item.title: All eyes are on Trump's reaction to the 'mother of all deals' between India and the EU
item.description: The trade deal is being widely seen as a strategic hedge against volatile U.S. trade policies.

item.title: The 'middle powers' are having a moment, but can they stand up to Trump?
item.description: Some are looking to the world's "middle powers" as a possible bulwark against increasing unilateralism among global superpowers.

item.title: South Korea scrambles to pass U.S. investment bill after Trump threatens higher tariffs
item.description: The bill aims to establish a state-run investment corporation and fund to manage Seoul's planned $350 billion investment pledge to Washington.

item.title: ‘Never interrupt your adversary when he’s making a mistake’: Why Beijing isn't rushing to answer Trump’s tariff broadside
item.description: Analysts expect the U.S.-China trade truce to hold as Beijing bets Trump won’t follow through on his threats ahead of a leaders’ meeting in April.

item.title: Hyundai shares fall after Trump says tariffs on South Korean autos, pharma to rise to 25%
item.description: South Korean-based automaker Hyundai Motor is the largest importer of new vehicles from that country into the United States.
